etymology.description: 红 + 菜 + 头 = red + vegetable + head (bulb/root).
etymology.interpretation: Literally ‘red vegetable head,’ highlighting the beet’s deep‑red, bulbous root. 头 here functions as a colloquial suffix for a rounded/root part of a plant.
etymology.simplification: Standard character simplifications to reduce strokes: 紅→红 (糸→纟), 頭→头; 菜 unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我买了两个红菜头(我買了兩個紅菜頭)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎi le liǎng gè hóngcàitóu.

examples.chinese: 红菜头汁颜色很浓(紅菜頭汁顏色很濃)，味道甜中带土香(味道甜中帶土香)。
examples.pinyin: Hóngcàitóu zhī yánsè hěn nóng, wèidào tián zhōng dài tǔ xiāng.
examples.english: Beetroot juice has a deep color and tastes sweet with an earthy aroma.

examples.chinese: 我们用红菜头做沙拉(我們用紅菜頭做沙拉)，也可以炖汤(也可以燉湯)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yòng hóngcàitóu zuò shālā, yě kěyǐ dùn tāng.
examples.english: We make salad with beetroot, and it can also be stewed in soup.
